author: .vbuterin
content: Dunno how I feel about ephemeral code; generally almost all code is part of some application that is being used many times, so it's easier to just publish it once and then make a delegatecall wrapper of it

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't think this is always true.  Imagine a user who wants to execute an AR itrary series of transactions that is unique to a particular use case (like Gnosis multisig transaction builder).

author: sky.cactus
content: While there will certainly be cases where two users do close enough to the same series of steps that you could generalize it into a single deployed instance of a thing (likely parameterized), the library of such things would be incredibly large and it is unknown up front which thing makes sense to generalize and which it doesn't.

author: sky.cactus
content: This means that from a practicality standpoint, reusing code in this context is non-trivial and likely not worth the engineering work to get right (not to mention it being more code that can go wrong).
